sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find (A⊕B) x (A∩B) and (B⊕A) x (A∩B), and show that they are not equal, thereby proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
